Message.Msg: Ask "Raptor" to explain proxy servers to you.

Message.Title: Now it is official: America needs more gun control
Message.Msg: After listening to all of the Sunday talk shows, it appears that a concensus has been reached by the main stream media, most of our dear leaders in Washington, and now finally the government of the communist People's Republic of China.They all agree, it is time to disarm American citizens and have stronger gun control laws. I know that I will feel safer knowing that law abiding citizens will no longer have the right to own or bear arms. Thank you all for helping me to see the light and learn to follow the way "forward" . In your heart you know he is right, The Frogg
I will take a look at this.

Topic.Title: Now it is official: America needs more gun control

Message.Msg: What happens if the bad guy cannot get a gun? That is way too complicated, huh?

Topic.Title: Now it is official: America needs more gun control

Message.Msg: Bad guys ALWAYS get guns. Look at Stalin and Charman Mao. Look at the drug gangs in Mexico. Many of their weapons come from both military and police sources. You can even make a simple one shot pistol and use it to get a better one.

Topic.Title: Now it is official: America needs more gun control

Message.Msg: It is such stuff and nonsense that dreams are made of.---Clifton Fadiman

Topic.Title: Now it is official: America needs more gun control

Message.Msg: Does a bad guy ever have a problem getting anything illegal? Does a bad guy care if he's breaking the law? Wake up.

Message.Title: mellanox stock long strong bullish start by friday

Topic.Title: Now it is official: America needs more gun control

Message.Msg: So why do we have laws against drugs? According to your logic, drug heads can always find drugs; rapests can always find victumes; thieves can always steal. Why do we have laws against anything if the logic is crooks are not going to pay attention to laws anyway.. Making guns harder to buy/own will not solve all the problem. But if we can solve half the problem that would be a big improvement. Does a policy have to work 100% of the time before it is a good policy? I would take a 50% decrease in murder and be pretty pleased. That means half of those kids in Conn would be alive today. I would take that. By the way, I just read where another person was exercising his 2nd amendment rights this morning. He set a fire then shot and killed two firemen when they responded. Too bad about the firemen. But at least someone got to use his second amendment rights and, god forbid, we take away the shoters' rights. Too bad idiots like you don't think about the firemens rights.

Message.Title: After Hours Quotes...
Message.Msg: ..."There are no strangers on Christmas Eve." - “Beyond Tomorrow” “Happy, happy Christmas, that can win us back to the delusions of our childhood days, recall to the old man the pleasures of his youth, and transport the traveler back to his own fireside and quiet home!” - Charles Dickens “People can't concentrate properly on blowing other people to pieces if their minds are poisoned by thoughts suitable to the twenty-fifth of December.” – Ogden Nash "Christmas, in its final essence, is for grown people who have forgotten what children know. Christmas is for whoever is old enough to have denied the unquenchable spirit of man." - Margaret Cousins "They err who thinks Santa Claus comes down through the chimney; he really enters through the heart." - Mrs. Paul Ell "December 21, the end of the world, is a Friday. So it means dress is casual." –David Letterman “Christmas is the day that holds all time together.” - Alexander Smith “Probably the reason we all go so haywire at Christmas time with the endless unrestrained and often silly buying of gifts is that we don't quite know how to put our love into words.” – Harlan Miller “Why is Christmas just like a day at the office? You do all the work and the fat guy with the suit gets all the credit.” - anonymous “Christmas! The very word brings joy to our hearts. No matter how we may dread the rush, the long Christmas lists for gifts and cards to be bought and given--when Christmas Day comes there is still the same warm feeling we had as children, the same warmth that enfolds our hearts and our homes.” - Joan Winmill Brown "Christmas is a time when you get homesick - even when you're home." - Carol Nelson

Message.Title: After Hours Quotes (cont.)...
Message.Msg: ... “The Christmas season has come to mean the period when the public plays Santa Claus to the merchants.” – John Andrew Holmes " The perfect Christmas tree? All Christmas trees are perfect!" - Charles N. Barnard "There is a remarkable breakdown of taste and intelligence at Christmastime. Mature, responsible grown men wear neckties made of holly leaves and drink alcoholic beverages with raw egg yolks and cottage cheese in them." - P.J. O’Rourke "According to a new poll, most Americans think Santa Claus is a Democrat – which is really odd because when I think of a fat, old white man who hires unskilled labor, I think Republican." – Conan O’Brien “Christmas waves a magic wand over this world, and behold, everything is softer and more beautiful.” - Norman Vincent Peale “Somehow, not only for Christmas, But all the long year through, The joy that you give to others, Is the joy that comes back to you. And the more you spend in blessing, The poor and lonely and sad, The more of your heart's possessing, Returns to you glad.” - John Greenleaf Whittier “Christmas is a time when everybody wants his past forgotten and his present remembered. What I don't like about office Christmas parties is looking for a job the next day.” - Phyllis Diller “What is Christmas? It is tenderness for the past, courage for the present, hope for the future. It is a fervent wish that every cup may overflow with blessings rich and eternal, and that every path may lead to peace.” - Agnes M. Pharo “Christmas ... is not an eternal event at all, but a piece of one's home that one carries in one's heart.” - Freya Stark "The best Christmas trees come very close to exceeding nature." - Andy Rooney “In the old days, it was not called the Holiday Season; the Christians called it 'Christmas' and went to church; the Jews called it 'Hanukka' and went to synagogue; the atheists went to parties and drank. People passing each other on the street would say 'Merry Christmas!' or 'Happy Hanukka!' or (to the atheists) 'Look out for the wall’!" - Dave Barry

Message.Title: After Hours Quotes (3)...
Message.Msg: ... “Even as an adult I find it difficult to sleep on Christmas Eve. Yuletide excitement is a potent caffeine, no matter your age.” – Carrie Latet “Blessed is the season which engages the whole world in a conspiracy of love!” – Hamilton Wright Mabie “Dear Lord, I've been asked, nay commanded, to thank Thee for the Christmas turkey before us... a turkey which was no doubt a lively, intelligent bird... a social being... capable of actual affection... nuzzling its young with almost human- like compassion. Anyway, it's dead and we're gonna eat it. Please give our respects to its family...” - Berke Breathed “Let Us Keep Christmas, Whatever else be lost among the years, Let us keep Christmas still a shining thing; Whatever doubts assail us, or what fears, Let us hold close one day, remembering It's poignant meaning for the hearts of men. Let us get back our childlike faith again.” - Grace Noll Crowell “ I will honor Christmas in my heart and try to keep it all the year.” - Ebenezer Scrooge "Today the Nobel Peace Prize was awarded to the European Union. The peace prize is awarded in Oslo. When someone told me, I said, 'Norway?' He said, 'Yes, way’.” – Craig Ferguson “Nobody sees Santa Claus, but that is no sign that there is no Santa Claus. The most real things in the world are those that neither children nor men can see.” - Francis P. Church to Virginia “Hey Santa, how much for your list of naughty girls?” - Jon "Unless we make Christmas an occasion to share our blessings, all the snow in Alaska won't make it 'white'." - Bing Crosby “Isn't it funny that at Christmas something in you gets so lonely for — I don't know what exactly, but it's something that you don't mind so much not having at other times.” – Kate Bosher “It was the Yuletide, that men call Christmas, though they know in their hearts it is older than Bethlehem and Babylon, older than Memphis and Mankind.” – H.P. Lovecraft

Message.Title: After Hours Quotes (final)...
Message.Msg: ... “Never worry about the size of your Christmas tree. In the eyes of children, they are all 30 feet tall.” – Larry Wilde "Roses are reddish Violets are bluish; it weren't for Christmas We'd all be Jewish." – Benny Hill “May you have the gladness of Christmas which is hope; The spirit of Christmas which is peace; The heart of Christmas which is love.” - Ada V. Hendricks “The Supreme Court has ruled that they cannot have a nativity scene in Washington, D.C. This wasn't for any religious reasons. They couldn't find three wise men and a virgin.” - Jay Leno “It was always said of him, that he knew how to keep Christmas well, if any man alive possessed the knowledge. May that be truly said of us, and all of us! And so, as Tiny Tim observed, ‘God Bless Us, Every One’!” - Charles Dickens “Christmas Eve was a night of song that wrapped itself about you like a shawl. But it warmed more than your body. It warmed your heart... filled it, too, with a melody that would last forever.” - Bess Streeter Aldrich “Peace on earth will come to stay, When we live Christmas every day.” - Helen Steiner Rice "McDonald's reported today that it had better than expected sales in the month of November. Executives credit the success to increased advertising, new menu items, and two states legalizing weed.” – Jimmy Fallon “We hear the beating of wings over Bethlehem and a light that is not of the sun or of the stars shines in the midnight sky. Let the beauty of the story take away all narrowness, all thought of formal creeds. Let it be remembered as a story that has happened again and again, to men of many different races, that has been expressed through many religions, that has been called by many different names. Time and space and language lay no limitations upon human brotherhood. - New York Times, December 25, 1937 “I like the Christmas that fulfills my needs ... to be forgiven from greed and selfishness, to fill my empty soul with peace and compassion, for hope and faith and charity, for myself renewed and hope restored in an erring world.” – Robert Wigert “The message of Christmas is that the visible material world is bound to the invisible spiritual world.” – unknown “Have a joyous holiday, all. Peace on Earth is the ultimate goal. Concede nothing to hatred, ignorance or fear, and bring glad tidings of good will to all.” - echo2165 “Christmas, children, is not a date. It is a state of mind.” - Mary Ellen Chase

Topic.Title: Now it is official: America needs more gun control

Message.Msg: How about the word ignorant to describe your shallow rant. Lots of conservatives do not share your limited view on the world. Blame Obama too for all your failings in life while you are at it.

Topic.Title: Now it is official: America needs more gun control

Message.Msg: "By the way, I just read where another person was exercising his 2nd amendment rights this morning" Wrong! He didn't have a 2nd amendment right. The report I saw indicated he was a convicted killer let out of jail. As a convicted felon put back on the street, he could not LEGALLY own or have a gun in his possession. How did that law work out for those unfortunate firemen?

Topic.Title: Now it is official: America needs more gun control

Message.Msg: Yea Ha. it's Dodge City all over again. If you ignorant fools didn't have a gun I wouldn't have to worry about a cop not being around. Smaller government but a cop on every corner. How does that work? Have you not noticed that your ideas of the old wild west hasn't worked?

Topic.Title: Now it is official: America needs more gun control

Message.Msg: The biggest mass school killing in US was done with explosives back in 1927 in Bath, Michigan. So it doesn't take guns to kill people, but it takes a crazy person. The Libs don't seem to understand that. Obama's kids have 11 armed guards at their school, so I don't see an issue with all other schools having at least one armed security officer. I believe almost 20% of all high schools already have some type of armed officer, so expanding the program to include all schools is not a reach. Also, it is crazy people who kill and not the gun. If there were no guns, then these crazy people would be like suicide bombers and that would be worse than trying to protect against someone carrying a gun.
